data.question: What is the overpotential required by Ni-MOF to produce a geometric current density of 10 mA cm−2?
How many water molecules are coordinated in the Ni-C complex?
What is the main difference in the structure between Ni-MOF and Ni-C?
data.answer: Ni-MOF has a 2D sheet structure with one water coordination, whereas Ni-C has a four water molecule coordinated charged complex.

data.question: True or False: Both Ni-MOF and Ni-C exhibited good thermal stability according to Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
What is the overpotential required by Ni-C to produce a geometric current density of 10 mA cm−2?
What transformation occurs to Ni-MOF and Ni-C during electrocatalysis according to the post-catalytic analysis?
data.answer: They are converted to nickel hydroxides/oxyhydroxides and act as the catalytic centre.

data.question: True or False: The Ni-MOF based catalyst exhibited excellent stability over 72 hours.
What is the charge transfer resistance of the Ni-MOF catalyst?
True or False: The Ni-C complex showed better OER activity than the Ni-MOF.
What is the role of DABCO in the synthesis of Ni-MOF?
data.answer: DABCO acts as a bidentate coordination that interconnects the 1D coordination polymer generated by BDC, producing a 2D network structure.

data.question: True or False: The Ni-MOF required a lower overpotential to achieve a current density of 10 mA cm−2 compared to commercial RuO2.
What is the Tafel slope value for the Ni-MOF?
True or False: The Ni-C complex exhibited excellent stability over 72 hours.
What is the main advantage of having a 2D sheet structure in Ni-MOF for electrocatalytic OER activity?
data.answer: The 2D sheet structure with labile water coordination enhances the electrocatalytic OER activity.

data.question: True or False: The Ni-MOF and Ni-C have the same coordination environment.
What is the electrochemical double layer capacitance (Cdl) of the Ni-MOF?
True or False: The Ni-MOF and Ni-C were transformed into nickel hydroxides/oxyhydroxides with different activities due to their structural differences.
What is the significance of the low Tafel slope value for the Ni-MOF?
data.answer: It indicates faster reaction kinetics at the electrode surface compared to the Ni-C complex.

data.question: What is the charge transfer resistance of the Ni-C catalyst?
True or False: The Ni-MOF and Ni-C have the same overpotential requirement to produce a geometric current density of 10 mA cm−2.
